comments: The 58-digit cycle 1,0,1,6,9,4,9,1,5,2,5,4,2,3,7,2,8,8,1,3,5,5,9,3,2,2,0,3,3,8,9,8,3,0,5,0,8,4,7,4,5,7,6,2,7,1,1,8,6,4,4,0,6,7,7,9,6,6 in this sequence and the others based on fifty-ninths, gives the successive digits of the smallest integer which is multiplied by six when the final digit is moved from the right hand end to the left hand end. - _Ian Duff_, Jan 09 2009, Jan 12 2009
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
